5. An "Advertorial" in the first pre-season issue of NFL Insider will feature the Mercata 'story' and highlight the innovative partnership with the Seahawks. However, it is Mercata's responsibility to write and provide the advertorial content for this purpose.

original: 2. Term.  The term of this Agreement shall commence on July 19, 1999 and shall thereafter continue until all above described Sponsor benefits are completed, but in no event beyond the end of the 1999 season (the "Term").  This Agreement is noncancellable by either party except for termination in accordance with Paragraph 7, below, and may be mutually extended by written agreement of the parties.
modified: 2. Duration. The duration of this Agreement will commence on July 19, 1999, and will automatically renew on a year-by-year basis thereafter, unless either party provides written notice of termination at least 60 days prior to the anniversary of the effective date. This automatic renewal will continue until one of the parties chooses to terminate the Agreement, which can be done by either party for any reason, effective as of the end of the then-current year. The Agreement may also be extended indefinitely by mutual written consent of both parties. However, in all events, this Agreement shall not extend beyond the conclusion of the 1999 season (the "Initial Term"). This Agreement is non-terminable prematurely by either party except as provided for in Paragraph 7, below.

original: 5.2. Use of FNW and Seattle Seahawks Trademarks.  Sponsor shall not, by this ------------------------------------------ Agreement, obtain any right, title or interest in the trade names or trademarks of FNW, the Seattle Seahawks, the NFL, NFL Enterprises, L.P., NFL Properties, Inc. or any affiliate of such, nor shall any such agreements give Sponsor the right to use, refer to, or incorporate in marketing or other materials the names, logos, trademarks, designs, identifications or copyrights of&bbsp;FNW, the Seattle Seahawks, the NFL, NFL Enterprises, L.P., and NFL Properties, Inc. without the prior written approval of FNW, which approval may be withheld in FNW's reasonable discretion. Sponsor may use Seahawks trademarks for promotional purposes as necessary to convey the Sponsor benefits described herein. However, all such rights shall expire at the end of the 1999 regular season.
ollama_generated: 5.2. Use of FNW and Seattle Seahawks Trademarks. The Sponsor retains no implied or explicit rights to the trade names or trademarks of FNW, the Seattle Seahawks, the NFL, NFL Enterprises, L.P., NFL Properties, Inc., or any affiliate thereof, nor does this agreement grant the Sponsor permission to utilize, reference, or incorporate these entities' names, logos, trademarks, designs, identifications, or copyrights in marketing materials without FNW's express, written consent, which may be withheld at FNW's sole discretion. However, the Sponsor is granted limited permission to employ Seattle Seahawks trademarks for promotional purposes as necessary to describe the benefits outlined herein. Importantly, these rights persist beyond the 1999 regular season, unless explicitly terminated in writing by FNW.

original: 6. Indemnification.  FNW agrees to defend, indemnify and hold Sponsor harmless --------------- from and against all claims, suits, liabilities, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorney costs and fees, for injury to, including death of, persons (whether they be third persons or employees of either of the parties hereto) or any loss of or damage to property in any manner arising from or relating to the rights conveyed herein, with the understanding that this obligation shall not apply to, and Sponsor agrees to defend, indemnify and hold FNW and its officers, directors, employees and agents harmless from and against, all losses, claims, suits, demands, actions, liabilities, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorney costs and fees, for injury to, including death of, persons (whether they be third persons or employees of either of the parties hereto) or any loss of or damage to property in any manner arising from the content of any advertising copy supplied by Sponsor or the negligence or intentional misconduct of Sponsor or its officers, employees or agents.
modified: 6. Indemnity and Hold Harmless Obligations. Sponsor shall indemnify, defend, and hold FNW free from any claims, suits, liabilities, costs, and expenses, including reasonable attorney fees, for injury to or death of persons (whether they be third parties or employees of either party) or any loss or damage to property, arising out of or in connection with the content of any advertising copy provided by Sponsor, or resulting from the negligence or intentional misconduct of Sponsor, its officers, employees, or agents. In contrast, FNW's obligation to indemnify, defend, and hold Sponsor harmless shall be limited to claims arising from or relating to the rights conveyed herein and shall not extend to losses, claims, suits, demands, actions, liabilities, costs, and expenses incurred due to FNW's negligence or intentional misconduct, or that of its officers, employees, or agents.

original: (c) The other party materially defaults in the performance of its material obligations under this Agreement and such other party fails to correct such breach within thirty (30) days of written notice.
ollama_generated: (c) If a material default occurs in the performance of a material obligation by one party under this Agreement, and such default is not remedied within thirty (30) days following receipt of written notice, then the non-defaulting party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement without further liability.

original: 12. Confidentiality.  Each of the parties deems the provisions of this Agreement --------------- to be confidential and proprietary in nature.  FNW and Sponsor each agree that the terms of this Agreement will be kept confidential and will not be disclosed in any manner whatsoever, in whole or in part, by either party without the prior written consent of the other party except to the extent necessary for such party to enforce its rights under this Agreement or as either party may be advised by its legal counsel that it is obligated to disclose the terms of such agreements.  Moreover, each party agrees to disclose the terms of this Agreement only to its respective&sbsp;officers, employees, agents and representatives who need to know of such terms and who agree to be bound by the confidentiality terms of this Paragraph.  Each party shall be responsible for any breach of this Paragraph by its respective officers, employees, agents and representatives.  The terms of this Paragraph shall survive the expiration or termination of this Agreement for whatever reason for a period of three (3) years after such expiration or termination.  Notwithstanding the foregoing, FNW may disclose the terms of this Agreement to King County, Washington and to lenders, legal counsel, and financial advisors.
ollama_generated: 12. Confidentiality. Each of the parties considers the contents of this Agreement --------------- as strictly confidential and belonging to a protected category. FNW and Sponsor mutually agree that they will maintain the secrecy of this Agreement and shall not divulge its details in any form, be it wholly or partially, without obtaining prior written consent from each other. However, each party may disclose the terms of this Agreement to their respective officers, employees, agents, and representatives if deemed necessary for enforcing their rights under this Agreement. It is further agreed that these individuals shall be bound by the confidentiality provisions stated within this Paragraph. Any breach of confidentiality by any party's officers, employees, agents, or representatives will hold the primary responsible party liable. The confidentiality obligations set forth in this Paragraph shall continue to apply for a period of three (3) years post-termination or expiration of this Agreement. Notably, FNW may disclose the terms of this Agreement to King County, Washington, lenders, legal counsel, and financial advisors without seeking prior written consent.

FOOTBALL NORTHWEST LLC                                MERCATA, INC.

In the event that either party fails to fulfill its obligations under this Agreement, it shall be incumbent upon the aggrieved party to make a good-faith effort to negotiate and resolve any disputes arising from such breach informally, prior to initiating formal legal action. However, should informal resolution prove unsuccessful, either party reserves the right to pursue legal remedies without first obtaining the consent or approval of the other party.

In contrast, in the original clause, both parties were required to attempt informal resolution before pursuing legal action, whereas in this revised version, one party is not obligated to seek informal resolution if they deem it necessary to pursue immediate legal action.

Title:  Representative in Corporate Sales         Title:  Chief Executive Officer -------------------------  -------------------------

In this revised clause, the roles of Scott S. Patrick and Tom Van Horn have been slightly redefined. Instead of being Vice President and Corporate Sales (VP/Corporate Sales) and President & CEO respectively, they are now a Representative in Corporate Sales and the Chief Executive Officer. This change may imply that the representative role has more flexibility in decision-making and can act on behalf of the company in sales-related matters, while the CEO is still ultimately responsible for the overall management and leadership of the organization.
